title: Dzukou Valley
short_description: A trekking paradise on the Nagaland-Manipur border, famous for the endemic Dzukou Lily.
long_description: Dzukou Valley is a valley located at the borders of the states of Nagaland and Manipur. This valley is well known for its natural environment, seasonal flowers and flora and fauna. It is situated at an altitude of 2452 m above sea level. The valley is famous for its wide range of flowers in every season but the most famous one is the Dzukou Lily and only found in this valley. The landscape is characterized by rolling hills covered in dwarf bamboo giving it a manicured lawn appearance.
wildlife_significance: Home to the rare and endemic Dzukou Lily (Lilium mackliniae).
major_experiences: 3-4 hour trek from Viswema or Jakhama
Camping in caves or guest house
guides_and_tips: Carry your own food and sleeping bags if planning to camp. Facilities are very basic. Winters are sub-zero.
how_to_reach: By Air: Dimapur (74 km from Kohima). By Road: Reach Kohima, then drive to Viswema (25 km) or Jakhama (20 km) start points.
permits_and_fees: Inner Line Permit (ILP) required for Nagaland. Valley entry fee collected by local youth association.
conservation_notes: Plastic free zone. Do not pluck the lilies.
sample_itinerary: Day 1: Drive from Kohima to Viswema. Steep trek uphill (1 hour) then flat walk (2 hours). Reach guest house. Overnight. Day 2: Explore valley floor. See lilies. Trek down via Jakhama route (steeper). Return to Kohima.
safety_tips: Carry warm clothes even in summer nights. Rain is frequent.

operating_season.best_months: June to September (Flowers), October to April (Views)
operating_season.off_season: Monsoon can make trails slippery but flowers are best then.
operating_season.season_notes: Winter is great for clear views but freezing cold.

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Local community manages the valley fees.
